title: Rock hyrax
summary:
The rock hyrax (/ˈhaɪ.ræks/; Procavia capensis), also called dassie, Cape hyrax, rock rabbit, and (in the King James Bible) coney, is a medium-sized terrestrial mammal native to Africa and the Middle East. Commonly referred to in South Africa as the dassie (IPA: [dasiː]; Afrikaans: klipdassie),[3] it is one of the five living species of the order Hyracoidea, and the only one in the genus Procavia.[1]
Rock hyraxes weigh 4–5 kg (8.8–11.0 lb) and have short ears and tail.[3]
